CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Merchandise Purchase stage positioned above or below the Post-Event Feedback stage?
SRP.A: The Merchandise Purchase stage is positioned {below} the Post-Event Feedback stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Attendance?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Attendance is {1410}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Fan Engagement?
VE.A: The value of stage Fan Engagement is {933}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Event Feedback?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Event Feedback is {702}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Event Attendance, with a value of {1410}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Event Reattendance, with a value of {429}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback?
SC.A: Decreased by {231} Participants from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 817? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Attendance} stage has {1410}, the {Fan Engagement} stage has {933}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 473? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 473 and 817? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {702}, the {Merchandise Purchase} stage has {517}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Attendance} to {Fan Engagement} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Merchandise Purchase to Event Reattendance, or from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Fan Engagement} to {Post-Event Feedback} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase, or from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Attendance} to stage {Fan Engagement} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Event Attendance} and {Fan Engagement} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Merchandise Purchase} and {Event Reattendance} stages.
